meanings.definition: Relating to the study of biological rhythms.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted a chronobiologic research on the sleep patterns of mice.
meanings.sent2: Her chronobiologic approach to understanding the body's internal clock was groundbreaking.
meanings.sent3: The chronobiologic investigation into the plants' growth cycles revealed some interesting findings.
meanings.sent4: His chronobiologic perspective shed light on the natural ebb and flow of life.
meanings.sent5: The chronobiologic nature of the sunflower's movement fascinated the students.

meanings.definition: Involving the measurement and analysis of biological timekeeping systems.
meanings.sent1: The team used a chronobiologic method to track the circadian rhythms of the participants.
meanings.sent2: Their chronobiologic study provided valuable insights into the body's internal clock.
meanings.sent3: The chronobiologic experiment with the hamsters' sleep patterns was both informative and amusing.
meanings.sent4: The chronobiologic analysis of the birds' migration patterns revealed intricate timekeeping mechanisms.
meanings.sent5: The chronobiologic investigation into the bees' daily routines was meticulous and detailed.
